title: Pea Ridge National Military Park: Stop 6 West Overlook
body: Stop 6:  West Overlook         This view from the West Overlook shows the great distances involved in moving the armies to the battlefield. NPS Photo  This stop atop Big Mountain (Pea Ridge) offers visitors an idea of the great distances involved in the battle. Bentonville is 11 miles to the west, while Fayetteville is 29 miles to the south. There was no combat-related action that took place on this part of the mountain. Sigel's Troops passed by here during the night of the first day's battle.
